Profile Class Reference
[Language support library]

#include <Profile.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Performance profiling is important part of any game development.

Profile is a light-weight and high resolution performance profiling class.

Usage example: {verbatim}

void myFunc() { PROFILE(myFunc); ... }

main() { NS(Profile,beginFrame)(); for ( int i = 0 ; i < 100000 ; ++i ) myFunc(); NS(Profile,endFrame)();

for ( int i = 0 ; i < NS(Profile,count)() ; ++i ) printf( "%s: x%d, %g%%\n", NS(Profile,getName)(i), NS(Profile,getCount)(i), NS(Profile,getPercent)(i) ); } {verbatim}

static float getPercent (int i)

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

Enumerator:
MAX_BLOCKS  Maximum number of profiled blocks.

MAX_NAME  Maximum name length for a block (keep short to avoid overhead).

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Profile::Profile ( int  id,
const char *  sz 
) [inline]

Begins profiling a single block.

Do not use this method directly, but use PROFILE macro instead.

Exceptions:
Exception If high resolution timer not available.

Member Function Documentation

static void Profile::beginFrame (  )  [static]

Begins a time frame.

Frame is used to report back percentages which each block took. All blocks share the same time frame.

static void Profile::endFrame (  )  [static]

Ends a time frame.

See also:
beginFrame

static int Profile::id (  )  [static]

Returns unique id.

Do not use this method directly, but use PROFILE macro instead.
